item.description: Organic Food vs Conventional Food Before more efficient and eco-friendly alternatives to farming are developed, farmers should consider integrating both organic and conventional methods of farming.
chemical :any substance that has a definite composition If we know for sure what it’s made of every single time, then it is a chemical.
Matter and Its Properties Matter has many properties and classifications. Each of them can be useful in identifying an unknown sample of matter.
Atom The smallest unit of ordinary matter that forms a chemical element. ( Wikipedia) ![[Pasted image 20220820215220.png]] ![[Pasted image 20220820215230.png]]
Chemical Change A chemical reaction (change)is a process in which one or more substances, also called reactants, are converted to one or more different substances, known as products.

Chemical property “A chemical property is any of a material’s properties that becomes evident during, or after, a chemical reaction; that is, any quality that can be established only by changing a substance’s chemical identity.

Compound A substance that results from a combination of two or more different [[chemical]] [[Element|elements]], in such a way that the [[atom|atoms]] of the different elements are held together by chemical bonds that are difficult to break.
Copper An element for my project. ![[Pasted image 20220827163524.png]] Basic information Symbol: Cu Atomic number: 29 Atomic mass: 63.546 u Density: 8.
Element A pure substance that cannot be broken down into simpler, stable substances and is made of one type of atom.
Extensive properties A property that depends on the amount of matter present. ^dc0bb3 Examples include: Volume Mass Size Weight Length Opposite of [[intensive properties]].
Intensive properties A property that does not depend on the amount of matter present. ^946708 Examples include: Pressure Density Melting point Conductivity !
Mass Measure of matter. ^f7973d ![[Pasted image 20220818210846.png]]
Matter Anything that has mass and volume. Made up of [[atom|atoms]] and [[Molecule|molecules]]. ![[Pasted image 20220818211056.png]]
Mixture A combination of two or more substances that are not chemically bound. A mixture is physically mixed, so it can usually be separated.
Physical property A characteristic of matter that can be observed and measured without changing the chemical identity of the sample. (Opposite of [[Chemical property]])

Pure Substance A pure substance has a uniform composition throughout the entire sample–homogeneous. It cannot be seperated by physical means, as they are either [[compound|compounds]] or [[Element|elements]].
States of Matter There are many states of matter. Here is how to define the most common ones. Solid Definite volume and definite shape.
Chemistry :the study of the composition, structure, and properties of matter, the processes that matter undergoes, and the energy changes that accompany these processes.

14.2 Community Interactions Created: 2022-05-13 05:26 There are two main types of interactions organisms can have in an ecosystem. One is competition, which is where organisms have to fight for some limited biotic and/or aboitic resource, and the other is symbiosis, which is where organisms benefit or harm from another for their own benefit.

14.4 Population Growth Patterns Created: 2022-05-13 05:51 Populations grow in predictable patterns. Direct Factors in population size Population size is constantly changing due to four constantly changing factors: Births Births of new individuals increase the population size Immigration Movement of individuals from a population into another Emigration Movement of individuals from a population out to another Deaths Death of individuals within a population decreases its size Population growth Depending on the environment and its available resources, the growth of a species can either be very rapid or slow.
16.2 Air Quality Created: 2022-06-14 07:07 [[Smog]] [[Acid rain]]

16.3 Water Quality Created: 2022-05-17 05:30 How does the water quality affect the ecosystem? Terms and concepts Indicator species Biomagnification Effects on ecosystems Pollutants (chemical contaminants, raw sewage, trash, etc.
Acid rain Created: 2022-06-14 07:16 ![[Pasted image 20220614071938.png]] :type of precipitation produced when pollutants in the water cycle cause rain pH to drop below normal levels

Biodiversity Created: 2022-06-08 08:19 The diversity of living things in an environment ^05e849 Rainforests have great biodiversity Covers around 7% of Earth’s land, yet accounts for over 50% of all animal & plant species
Density-Dependent Limiting Factors Created: 2022-06-08 08:11 Limiting factors that are affected by the density of the population Competition [[14.

Density-Independent Limiting Factors Created: 2022-06-08 08:12 Limiting factors that are not affected by the population density Unusual weather & Natrual disasters Weather or natural disasters can’t be affected by how dense a population is Both can disrupt the ecosystem ex.
Ecology Unit Vocabulary (for lab) Created: 2022-06-08 08:06 List of all the vocabulary terms relevant to just this lab, not necessarily the entire unit.

Keystone species Created: 2022-06-08 08:21 ![[Pasted image 20220429062247.png]] A species that has an unusually large effect on its ecosystem Holds its ecosystem together like a keystone shown above ex.
Lake Grace lab organizer Created: 2022-05-27 06:03 **Claim: The sport fish population of Lake Grace is decreasing in size due to the use of herbicides **
Population Crash Created: 2022-06-08 08:09 A sudden decrease in population size Many factors can cause a population crash Seasons Natural disaster Disease [[14.
Smog Created: 2022-06-14 07:09 ![[Pasted image 20220614071000.png]] :type of air pollution caused by the interaction of sunlight with pollutants produced by fossil fuel emissions

Trophic Level Created: 2022-04-26 13:49 Definition: energy levels in a food chain Starts from the sun (not included as a tropic level) Producers/autotrophs: produces their own food Consumers/heterotrophs (different types) Herbivores Carnivores Omnivores Decomposers: decomposes dead organisms Note: energy moves from the most bottom trophic level to the highest

Types of Consumers Created: 2022-04-26 14:31 Scientists categorize consumers into 5 main categories. Each are different in what they consume. Note that these categories aren’t choices, meaning that vegans, who chose to only eat plants, are not herbivores.
